intro: Gymnadenia gracilis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to Europe, this variety thrives in moist, calcareous soils in woodland and meadow habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a compact, upright growth habit. It is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
